text: That's what you've been waiting for
This is what beauty can be
All for you, these beautiful girls!
This is how Samson was shorn:
Why am I here? This is crazy!
What were we like? It's so hazy!
What we need is a drink.
I see it all. It's like a movie in my head that plays and plays. It isn't just the bad things I remember. It's the whole damn show.
Waiting around for the girls upstairs
Money in my pocket to spend
"Honey, could you maybe get a friend for my friend?"
Hearing the sound of the girls above
Dressing to go on the town—
Clicking heels on steel and cement—
Picking up the giggles floating down through the vent—
Goddamnedest hours that I ever spent
Were waiting for the girls upstairs
That's where the keys hung and
That's where you picked up your mail...
Not to duck out of sight—
Girls looking frazzled and girls looking great
Girls in a frenzy to get to a date
Girls like a madhouse and two of them late...
Waiting around for the boys downstairs
Stalling as long as we dare
Which dress from my wardrobe of two?
(One of them was borrowed and the other was blue)
Holding our ground for the boys below
Giggling, wriggling out of our tights
Chattering and clattering down all of those flights—
God, I'd forgotten there ever were nights
Of waiting for the boys downstairs
We saw you in the wings
This joint is just as grand
Wait till you hear the band!
Waiting around for the girls upstairs
Very young and very old hat—
Everybody has to go through stages like that
Waiting around for the girls upstairs—
Life was fun, but oh, so intense
Everything was possible and nothing made sense
Back there when one of the major events
I have seen the ruins of Rome
I've been in the igloos of Nome
I have seen Rangoon and Soho
And I like them more than so-so
Peking has rickshaws, New Orleans jazz
Beirut has sunshine—that's all it has
Learning how to sing and dance
Waiting for that one big chance
All my dreams will be repaid
Hell, I'd even play the maid
Yeah, I'm talking to you, sir
Plus a tube of greasepaint and a follow-spot!
If I stick it long enough
I may get to strut my stuff
Like a Ziegfeld or a Weismann
There isn't time for any more
And as the years go on
The yearnings fade, the longings die
You learn to bid them all goodbye
At last you come to know
Life is slow but it seems exciting
And yes, I miss a lot
I married the right man then
And all I ever dreamed I'd be
The best I ever thought of me
Is every minute there to see
Who's that woman? I know her well
All decked out head to toe
She lives life like a carousel
Seems I see her everywhere I go
I know I know that woman
Love, she said, was a fad
The kind of love that she couldn't make fun of
Who's dressing for yet one more spree?
Each day I see her pass
Lord, Lord, Lord, that woman is me!
Who's thе saddest gal in town?
Who's been riding for a fall?
Who is she who plays the clown?
Is she out each night till three?
Does she laugh with too much glee?
Who's the saddest gal in town?
Who's dressing for yet one more spree?
Who is she who plays the clown?
I've seen 'em all and, my dear
Three bucks a night was the pay
In the depression was I depressed?
I've gotten through Herbert and J. Edgar Hoover
Gee, that was fun and a half
When you've been through Herbert and J. Edgar Hoover
I should've gone to an acting school
Next day it goes into hock
I've gotten through, "Hey, lady, aren't you whoozis?
Wow, what a looker you were"
Or, better yet, "Sorry, I thought you were whoozis
I've seen 'em all and, my dear
I got through all of last year
Lord knows, at least I've been there
Waking and pretending I reach for you
Wishing that the room might be filled with you
That I thought would never end
With her head against my head
What I'd say in case you didn't remember
Did I ever love you this much?
And I've always loved you this much...
I wore green the last time...
We can always feel this happy...
Wasted in pretending I reach for you
How much time can we hope that there will be?
Not much time, but it's time enough for me
If there's time to look up and see
With your head against my head
She makes you feel like a million bucks
She's with you, no matter how you feel
You're not the good guy, you're not the heel
You're not the dreamboat that sank—you're real
What's new, babe? You miss me?
You smell good, come kiss me
Hey, Margie, you wanna go dancing?
Des Moines was rotten and the deal fell through
I needed you to tell my troubles to—
You wanna go dancing? You wanna go driving?
You know how you cry, babe
Be good now, we'll speak, babe
It might be next week, babe—
She sees you're nothing and thinks you're king
She knows you've got other songs to sing
You still could be—hell, well anything
You miss me? I knew it
I don't love the right girl
One more kiss before we part
One more kiss to melt the heart
One more glimpse of the past...
One more kiss before we part
Not with tears or a sigh
Now that our love is done
How could I go it alone?
Could I wave the years away
How do you wipe tears away
Give up the joys I have known?
Not to fetch your pills again
Not to give those dinners for ten
And your shelves of the world's best books
And the evenings of martyred looks
Sullen glares from those injured eyes?
Leave the quips with a sting, jokes with a sneer
And the games not worth winning
What would I do on my own?
Could I live through the pain
With a boy half your age
Tell me, how could I leave
When I left long ago, love?
No, the point is, could you leave me?
Well, I guess you could leave me the house
Leave me the Braques and Chagalls and all that
You could leave me the stocks for sentiment's sake
And ninety percent of the money you make
And all of our friends and—

text: Hello, folks, we're into the Follies!
First, though, folks, we'll pause for a mo'
No, no, folks, you'll still get your jollies—
It's just I got a problem that I think you should know
See, I've been very perturbed of late, very upset
The things that I want, I don't seem to get
The things that I get—you know what I mean?
She says she really loves me—
She says that I'm her hero—
She says that if we parted—
She says that she'll be sick
I gotta get outta here quick!
She says that he's her idol—
Would suit her more than I
She says that I'm a washout—
I love her so much, I could die!
It's like I'm losing my mind
It's like I'm losing my mind?
The thought of you stays bright
Sometimes I stand in the middle of the floor
Or were you just being kind?
Or am I losing my mind?
The thought of you stays bright
Sometimes I stand in the middle of the floor
Or were you just being kind?
Or am I losing my mind?
